intro: Stachytarpheta coccinea, commonly known as scarlet rosemallow, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red bracts that surround its small white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of branches. Stachytarpheta coccinea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
